newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Sausage plans Java commerce software.
newsitem.headline: Sausage plans Java commerce software.

text.p: Australian Internet software company Sausage Software Ltd said on Wednesday it plans to operate the world's first Java-based web commerce system, eVend, scheduled to be commercially operational in April.
eVend allows Web content providers to protect their content and sell intellectual property over the Internet on a pay-per-view basis, Sausage said.
eVend will work on almost every type of computer connected to the Internet. It also means that Web surfers will use eVend without having to download and install any special software, it said.
The price for the eVend service is US$200 on an upfront fee basis. Sausage Software will also earn a commission on all transactions processed, Sausage Software said.
It said it has used a sliding scale in pricing eVend.
At 1.35 p.m. (0235 GMT), Sausage shares were one cent up at 23 cents.
